attributes.action: respect the rights of  the resident population of Cornwall, and in particular those of the fishermen of the Helford River and its environs in not allowing second home owners to prejudice the building of a vital new jetty to secure the working future of the area
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The people of Helford in Cornwall are being blocked from building a jetty to improve their livelihoods by mostly second home owners who hardly ever live there.

More than a million pounds worth of fish are landed there each year which has to be lugged up the beach because it has no jetty. A jetty would improve the lives and economy of the people that actually live in Helford.

According to a local resident, the Jetty plan has support from the council as well as the local environment groups who believe the Jetty plan is in keeping with the surrounding area.

Those people need your support so please sign up now and show your support for local hard working people who are trying their best to improve their businesses and their community

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "respect the rights of the resident population of Cornwall, and in particular those of the fishermen of the Helford River and its environs in not allowing second home owners to prejudice the building of a vital new jetty to secure the working future of the area."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22514


Prime Minister's Office
